name: Mount Webster

trails_config.name: Webster-Jackson Loop (Webster Branch)
trails_config.description: Branch off the Webster-Jackson Trail at the fork to climb Mount Webster’s side via the Webster Branch. The trail ascends steadily and includes a few scrambles near the summit. Atop Mount Webster, you’re greeted by the dramatic cliff edge known as the Webster Cliffs, with sheer drop-offs and breathtaking views down Crawford Notch. Many continue on to Mount Jackson and loop back down, creating a scenic figure-eight. The cliffs are a notorious peregrine falcon nesting area, so keep an eye out for soaring birds of prey.

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Mount Webster rises to 3910 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 3910 feet, Mount Webster is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Webster-Jackson Loop (Webster Branch)**, a **5.2 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Willard**, which is just 0.4 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
